slides.subtitle: Developing for Future-Ready Workforces

content.Problem: Construction curricula don’t teach the design skills needed to build immersive VR‑based HRI training.
content.Objective: Design and validate a VR environment that teaches Computational Thinking via robotic pick‑and‑place tasks.
content.Key Question: How can we **design** a high‑fidelity VR‑based HRI training system that effectively develops CT skills, boosts task performance, and supports transfer across terrestrial and extraterrestrial scenarios?
Approach: Unreal Engine sim with modular, progressive difficulty levels
Mecanum‑wheel robot arm pick‑and‑place task design
Iterative evaluation using a Knowledge‑Skill‑Attitude (KSA) framework

leftColumn.title: Hardware Components
items: Meta Quest 3 VR headset and controllers for immersive interaction
Robotic arm simulation with pick-and-place capabilities
Mecanum wheel platform for omni-directional movement
Physics engine for realistic object manipulation

rightColumn.title: Software Framework
items: Unreal Engine for high-fidelity environment rendering
Custom control interfaces for robotic components
Physics-based interaction system for realistic task execution
Data collection system for performance metrics
